description: From Late Latin bronchus, from Ancient Greek βρόγχος (brónkhos, “windpipe”)  +‎ -itis.

nouns.description: bronchitis (countable and uncountable, plural bronchitises or bronchitides)

entries.meaning: (uncountable) An inflammation of the bronchi of the lungs, that causes the cilia of the bronchial epithelial cells to stop functioning.
(countable) An occurrence of, a case (patient) of, or a type of bronchitis.
